definition: Shelley/abbr. for 珀西·比希·雪萊|珀西·比希·雪莱[Po4 xi1 · Bi3 xi1 · Xue3 lai2]
surname Xue
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
name of weed plant (fat hen, goosefoot, pigweed etc)/Chenopodium album
Percy Bysshe Shelley (1792-1822), English Romantic poet
pinyin: Po4 xi1 · Bi3 xi1 · Xue3 lai2

sentences.english: Byron and Shelley are usually considered as the Second Generation of the Romanic Movement.
sentences.chinese: 拜伦和雪莱通常被认为是浪漫运动的第二代。

sentences.english: This was insulting to Shelley and only likely to get me laughed at.
sentences.chinese: 这是对雪莱的侮辱，结果却使我可能成为笑柄。

sentences.english: The style Shelley is using here is that of popular lampoon .
sentences.chinese: 这里雪莱用的是通俗的嘲讽手法。

sentences.english: The appearance of Xuelai in Wu Mi's poetry is an image he carefully constructs.
sentences.chinese: 吴宓诗歌中的雪莱形象是他精心构建的他者形象。
济慈和雪莱是同时代人。

sentences.english: The Shelleys moved restlessly from place to place, and they suffered much unhappiness.
sentences.chinese: 雪莱一家经常到处迁徙，并经受了种种磨难。
雪莱和济慈是同时代的人。

sentences.english: Snow Lai another lyric poetry has the feeling of the imagination and beautiful of brilliancy with the result that.
sentences.chinese: 雪莱另一类抒情诗具有辉煌的想象和优美的情致。

sentences.english: Shelly was still living when Keats died.
There are few poets such as Keats and Shelly.
sentences.chinese: 像济慈和雪莱这样的诗人现在很少了。

sentences.english: A stanza of this sort is in many respects anomalous in Shelley's poetics.
sentences.chinese: 这种的诗节在雪莱的诗中很多方面是破格的。

sentences.english: There are few poets such as Keats and Shelley.
sentences.chinese: 像济慈和雪莱那样的诗人现在少了。

sentences.english: Such poets as Keats and Shelly wrote romantic poetry.
sentences.chinese: 有些诗人，如济慈和雪莱，写的是浪漫主义诗歌。

sentences.english: Shelley was still living when Keats died.
She made me brief a Shelley ode as though it were a legal argument.
sentences.chinese: 她让我像做法律论证一样，简述雪莱的诗赋。

definition: George Byron (1788-1824), English poet
Heinrich Heine (1797-1856), German lyric poet
Alexandr Sergeevich Pushkin (1799-1837), great Russian romantic poet
Geoffrey Chaucer (1343-1400), English poet, author of The Canterbury Tales 坎特伯雷故事集[Kan3 te4 bo2 lei2 Gu4 shi4 Ji2]
Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
Rabindranath Tagore (1861-1941), Indian poet and writer
Dickens (name)/Charles Dickens (1812-1870), great English novelist
Shakespeare (name)/William Shakespeare (1564-1616), poet and playwright
Stendhal
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Marcel Proust (1871-1922), French author
Horace, full Latin name Quintus Horatius Flaccus (65-8 BC), Roman poet
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
Franz Kafka (1883-1924), Czech Jewish writer
Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist
